post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

body: Be careful, you're probably thinking of the legendized founders. The real founders were actually pretty strange, Ben Franklin probably murdered someone and hid the body, George Washington owned slaves and passed a law limiting citizenship to white people (and even then only the ones he liked), Thomas Jefferson mutilated his bible, and Alexander Hamilton wanted a monarchy. And Sam Adams was a fucking lunatic who burned down his cousin John Adams's mansion over some argument. And they were almost all freemasons. Not that Britain was any better, they just weren't the godlike men they are portrayed as now (rebellions tend to need sketchy people like that too, Han Solo comes to mind).

parent.body: Likely many of the churches feel this way. Western churches suffer greatly from being feminized, and the women really run the show. The church I used to attend is decorated with frilly doilies and flowers, the women have a dozen different events and classes through the week and the last I heard they were ordaining them as pastors. I left a few years ago when we men were relegated to a tiny back room for the men's group while the women had the run of the joint. The thing is, this is the experience I've had at the past few churches I have attended long term and the churches I have visited. Women have been elevated in the chain of command above men, which is not biblical. Women ascribe to "experience" more than men do and are more sympathetic to perceived injustice and slights, ergo, the church has adopted the culture as a baseline for what is right and filters scripture through it where they can. In places where they cannot, ie: really bad sins like murder, they stand, but society as a whole also sees those things as bad. Things like abortion, divorce and adultery get a pass, though, because they are widely accepted by society as a whole, mostly by women, and scripture can be twisted to support them, or ignored where need be.

parent.body:
I think home groups should be where the church is meeting right now, bit unlike when the church began. I know some youtube people don't think "all churches are businesses and want your money", but I think they end up like that. As soon as a church starts to buy property and equipment and take on a staff then keeping money in the coffers becomes a high priority, and Christ can get pushed to the back shelf. And he does, because we see Western churches catering to their best customers! Women! Men don't spend a ton of money on religious stuff. A bible and maybe some studies. Women spend far more AND control where the money goes in a lot of homes. When you pay 10k a month in expenses you need to keep those tithes rolling in! The church I spoke of above once sent out letters urging people to tithe because they needed $120,000 to be in the black for the year! I also do their computer work (I still like some of the people there, just not the way the church is run) and they told me they had budgeted $12,000 to upgrade their network! During a pandemic, when that money could have gone to helping families in need and winning souls to Christ.

I don't care much for Western churches for more reasons then this, but this is a pretty big reason. Small churches. Home groups. Teaching others to go start home churches. That's where it's at.

body:
Populist is much different than alt right. Populism is an anti-establishment position based on overthrowing an existing power and wanting to do a better job yourself. Donald Trump is a prime example of this. Alt right/fascism on the other hand is basically socialism with traditional cultural beliefs instead of progressive ones: it values conformity, hierarchy, nationality, and tradition above all else, and believes government's prime function should be enforcing them. It's solidly pro-establishment and it's basically what AHS and CNN thinks conservatism is. Both are inconsistent with the original conservatives but the former at least has an appeal after 8 years of Obama, yet many people have now become the latter.

I do get what you're saying about more people coming in from other countries, but as you said it's mostly the same individuals who were conservatives before becoming more alt right.

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

body:
Why do you think women are more gullible? They may be a lot of times but that's usually because people teach them to believe everything they're told because it's assumed they won't be independent or self-sustaining. Both of the "scriptures" you quoted are obvious forgeries added by Roman scribes. Paul didn't write Titus and it doesn't even fit in the chronology of his life, and it teaches numerous heresies. 1 Corinthians 14:34-35 randomly appears smack in the middle of a completely unrelated passage about prophesy and contradicts his other statements, so I think you can put 2 and 2 together. The passage doesn't even make sense with it thrown in there. If you're still not convinced somehow the only "law" it could be referring to is the laws of the Roman empire--indeed, it was illegal for women to speak at a public assembly in Rome. Beyond that there actually manuscript evidence for this one, it has tons of variants and doesn't even appear in the same place half the time, and in two of the oldest manuscripts is marked with a symbol indicating that it wasn't present in some copies. It may have even been translated into greek from the latin version, which had a habit of any time Paul mentioned a wife's name before her husband in a positive light, they changed it to put the husband first. The Romans saw Christianity as a threat to their empire and pagan traditions, no wonder they were this hostile towards it. Here's just a few of Paul's real thoughts:

* 1 Corinthians 7 (direct contradiction of 1 Timothy and Titus which say the only purpose of a woman is to get married and have children, with 1 Timothy even equating their salvation to their bearing of children, which is also a works gospel. It also contradicts the requirement of church officials to be married in Timothy and Titus, which actually disqualify Paul himself as he was unmarried.)

* Galatians 3:28

* Romans 16 (direct contradiction of Titus and 1 Timothy as Phoebe is mentioned as a deacon)

I don't care even if Paul *did* say those things, in the gospels we have Mary Magdelene and several others, not to mention all the examples in the old testament, both of which even include prophets.

I'm not "afraid" of women in the church at all, but scripture says they should not be in positions of leadership or teaching in the church both because they are more gullible and because God has ordained an order of authority, with women being under the authority of their fathers and then their husbands. Neither Jesus nor Paul prescribed putting women in either one of those positions and Titus 2 tells older christian women exactly what they SHOULD be teaching the younger generation. Daughters and wives are to ask their husbands for direction on scripture as prescribed in 1 Corinthians (14:35).

Yeah, it was a few different things that got me out of that church. The people were nice, but the adherence to the Word was lacking, as it seems to be much across the country. I left, but still keep in touch with some of the people there.

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

body: The truth is that the bible was established in AD 382. By the Council of *Rome*, the very same people who did most of the forgeries, and the biggest criteria was how much they conformed with the catholic church's beliefs at the time. In the first century they only had Jesus and the old testament scriptures, with the ones not spoken directly by God (by word or through prophesy) having the status of "writings good for reading" like the inter-testamental books. And Paul's books were merely letters addressed to churches during his missionary work. This is not my opinion, it is a historical fact. No one before the late 4th century would've known what "The Bible" was, they had a collection of all the separate books, which ones were authentic being regularly disputed until the catholic church "settled" the matter.

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

parent.body:
Yes stories of Saul and David predate the Babylonian captivity but they were not written down in their current form until after the Babylonian captivity.

There probably was an Etruscan King of Rome named Tarquin who was overthrown by republicans but anything from that era of Roman history is taken with a grain of salt by modern historians because we don't have much in the way of contemporary primary sources from that place and time. The same is true of King David and Saul.

Much of the old testament is collections of folktales and mythical heroes. You'll note there are multiple different stories in the Bible about how David and Saul met, about how the Jews captured Jerusalem, and even about who killed Goliath.

You'll also note that the stories of David and Saul are actually older than the story of Exodus despite supposedly occurring chronologically after Exodus supposedly happens. One of the reasons we know this is because their are references to David keeping idols (which no post Moses Jew would do). The Exodus tale seems to be manufactured from whole cloth then inserted into the historical narrative to, once again, justify the spiritual authority of a priest caste returning from foreign captivity. This is also the time in history where Judaism picks up a lot of Zoroastrian influence. 

On the subject of Saul and his unworthiness to be king, Saul's first fall out with God comes because Saul does not commit ethnic cleansing thoroughly enough.

"Now go and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass." Samuel-1 15:3

You gotta love how Yahweh specifically reminds the Israelites to not forget to kill the babies too.

Prostitution is not legal, and polygamy was forbidden for kings.

> That does not in any way contradict my assertion, which is shared by most ancient middle eastern scholars, that the old testament in its current form was compiled and edited from preexisting myths and legends to form a narrative that was politically expedient for the people writing it at the time.

Yes it does, as you said the pentacheuch wasn't written until after the Babylonian captivity, and that right there is a fragment of the book of Numbers in Jerusalem from the first temple period. It's an amulet, so of course it's only going to include part of it. Also, there is an inscription in Egypt which may refer to Moses. A list of 10 virtues was also found in egypt that is very much like the ten commandments, which at the very least shows that the two groups influenced each other. And the alphabet used by the Canaanites and Israelites is clearly based on egyptian hieroglyphics. There is quite a lot of evidence that the Hebrews came to Canaan from Egypt.
body_html:
That is legal according to Jewish religious law

Prostitution is not legal, and polygamy was forbidden for kings.

That does not in any way contradict my assertion, which is shared by most ancient middle eastern scholars, that the old testament in its current form was compiled and edited from preexisting myths and legends to form a narrative that was politically expedient for the people writing it at the time.

Yes it does, as you said the pentacheuch wasn't written until after the Babylonian captivity, and that right there is a fragment of the book of Numbers in Jerusalem from the first temple period. It's an amulet, so of course it's only going to include part of it. Also, there is an inscription in Egypt which may refer to Moses. A list of 10 virtues was also found in egypt that is very much like the ten commandments, which at the very least shows that the two groups influenced each other. And the alphabet used by the Canaanites and Israelites is clearly based on egyptian hieroglyphics. There is quite a lot of evidence that the Hebrews came to Canaan from Egypt.

parent.body:
"He also had multiple wives and owned prostitute slaves"

That is legal according to Jewish religious law

"Just so you know, a fragment of Numbers was discovered on an amulet found in Jerusalem, in the alphabet they used prior to Babylonian captivity"

That does not in any way contradict my assertion, which is shared by most ancient middle eastern scholars, that the old testament in its current form was compiled and edited from preexisting myths and legends to form a narrative that was politically expedient for the people writing it at the time. 

"Dr. Wayne Pitard has stated that although evidence for the antiquity of the Priestly Blessing is now compelling, this does not necessarily mean that the Book of Numbers already existed at that time.[8] Dr. James R. Davila has similarly pointed out that the idea that while the scrolls show that "some of the material found in the Five Books of Moses existed in the First Temple period", the suggestion that they are "proof that the Five Books of Moses were in existence during the First Temple period" (as described in an article in the Israeli newspaper Haaretz) is "an overinterpretation of the evidence.""

https://paleojudaica.blogspot.com/2004_09_26_archive.html#109644758320238769

https://www.nytimes.com/2004/09/28/science/solving-a-riddle-written-in-silver.html

post.body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.
